page.title: 07TOY MAKING IN RISELEY
page.content: The newest industry in Riseley was started two years ago by Mr. Cooper who enjoyed making furniture for his daughters' large dolls. It is a small firm in a double garage by the side of his house. Before he manufactures anything he designs it and makes a prototype. He then takes on the role of salesman and goes out to shops to try to get orders or perhaps has a stand at a toy fair which will be visited by many shopkeepers. His firm manufactures mostly bedroom furniture from plastic coated chipboard which he cuts to shape and drills as necessary. The pieces are then fixed together by Upper School Pupils using pegs and glue. Ladies in the village are paid to sew quilts etc. in their own homes.
